Fields.DialogueText: Konnichiwa, Kanchou. Is it true?
Hello to you, too, Kamikaze.
The navigator reports that we are now steady on a course of zero-four-zero. Is it true or not?
It's true. We're heading back to Japan for a brief stop in Tokyo.
Sugoi! I was a bit bored with our patrols around Formosa.

Fields.MenuText: It was an important duty, right? Ensuring the emperor's territories were safe?
I'm ready for a change.
You think patrol duty is beneath you.

Fields.DialogueText: It was important, and we did it.
As am I.
I consider patrol duty without action beneath us, yes.
We're the emperor's ichiban destroyer, Kanchou. We can always do more.
Well, whatever comes next, at least you'll see the homeland for a bit.
Hai!
Let's look good for our homecoming, shall we?
I will mobilize the crew at once.
Remind them that Morganas come first. Cleaning the ship comes second.
Consider it done.
@BATTLE
Ready for inspection, Kanchou.
Thank you, Kamikaze. Hand me that white glove.
Here it is. Good luck finding any dirt or oil with that!

Fields.MenuText: I like that confidence.
Let's get started, then.
Is that a challenge?

Fields.DialogueText: And I will always strive to earn it.
At once, Kanchou.
Shall me make it one? I will accept any stakes you wish to set.
Hm.
Hmm.
Any troubles, Kanchou?
No.
I'm waiting.
Hmmm.
No dirt or oil on that white glove yet?
None! Great job with the inspection, Kamikaze. Tell the crew I'm pleased with the ship's cleanliness.
I will inform them at once.
*ALARM*
First things first. Morganas approaching.
Those damn Funayūrei had better not leave a stain on this perfectly clean ship!
@BATTLE
One thing at a time, Kamikaze.
Reporting as ordered, Kanchou.
Have a look at my desk. It's completely covered in stacks of paperwork.
With respect, Kanchou, that clutter is a bit unprofessional.
You should strive to clean it every day so that it does not become buried like this.
Very funny, Kamikaze. My desktop was clean one hour ago. Then, thirty minutes ago...
Thirty minutes ago...
Thirty minutes ago, the yeoman brought me all of these disciplinary reports.
Hai.
Eighty-two reports. Eighty-two individual reports documenting poor performance, procedural violations, and unprofessional behavior.
Eighty-two. Hai.
It gets better. It turns out that every single report was filed by the same person. Do you know who that was?
I do, Kanchou. It was me.
You filed a disciplinary report on over half of the crew!

Fields.MenuText: You're too strict. This will only turn them against you.
Is this a joke?
I'm glad somebody is willing to get tough with the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Quite the opposite. I am keeping them in line, Kanchou.
It is deadly serious, Kanchou.
When they challenge me, I do not flinch, Kanchou.
Good order and discipline are critical to a warship's performance.
I appreciate that. Just make sure you don't lose your perspective.
Keep us ship-shape and ready for combat, Kamikaze.
I will, Kanchou. Funayūrei may arrive at any--
*ALARM*
Time?
Honto desu ne.
@BATTLE
Okinawa is visible off the starboard bow, Kanchou.
Yes, Kamikaze. Just like it was visible off the starboard bow five minutes ago.
Did I report it once already?
That was your fourth report, actually.
Oh.

Fields.MenuText: Anxious to see home?
Is there something you aren't telling me?
Are you losing your mind?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, but not because of homesickness.
The sense of urgency I feel is difficult to contain.
No, of course not! I just...
I always want to make sure Japan is safe and well.
Well, in wartime, that can never be certain.
That's why I want to hurry.
Stay focused. Keep scanning the horizon, not just Okinawa.
Aye aye, Kanchou. Morganas will not take me by surprise.
That's all I ask.
Speak of the Funayūrei devils.
@BATTLE
Should I ask why you've been walking around the ship smelling whatever's in that bag?
*sniff* What?
That bag. You keep sniffing it.
Ah, yes! Here, put your head into the bag and inhale.
What?!
Trust me.
I, uh...
Hayaku!
What the hell? I'm the captain of this--
Hey! It's dark with this bag on my head.
Stop complaining and please tell me what you smell.
Fine. It smells like...

Fields.MenuText: ... like disrespect for a senior officer.
... like fish.
... like yellowfin tuna.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps your sense of humor is too subtle for me to grasp.
Not just any fish. Yellowfin tuna, Kanchou.
I am impressed, Kanchou! That's exactly what it is.
Although we couldn't stop for long in Okinawa, I managed to get a small shipment of yellowfin tuna for us.
That sounds delicious, but-
It is. A true Japanese delicacy.
-but I'm taking my head out of this bag.
Of course, Kanchou.
If there's enough for the whole crew, then let's make a meal out of it.
Hai. Perhaps these incoming Morganas will let us work up an appetite.
Incoming Morganas?
You probably didn't see them because you had your head inside of a bag.
You think?!
@BATTLE
What a complete disaster...
Is something troubling you?
I am distressed at the lack of respect our crew shows for Japanese traditions, Kanchou.
This must have something to do with the yellowfin tuna sushi.
The crew didn't like it.

Fields.MenuText: Nonsense. I'm sure they loved it.
Maybe they'd prefer it cooked.
You're trying too hard.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe some did, but not all of them.
Unacceptable!
Ie. I didn't try hard enough.
This crew needs to appreciate Japanese cuisine and culture!
I admire your dedication, but keep things in perspective.
A warship must run properly in every aspect.
I won't argue with that, but combat performance comes first.
I... I understand, Kanchou.
Kamikaze?
What?
Just so you know, I liked the tuna. It was delicious.
Arigatō, Kanchou. I appreciate that.
@BATTLE
Enemy inbound! Full speed into battle!
@BATTLE
Line up on the quarterdeck! You will be permitted to go ashore in Tokyo only when I allow it. Understood?
Yes, Kamikaze.
Yes, Kamikaze.
Yes, Kamikaze.
Step forward and let me inspect you. If your uniform and hygiene are perfect, you will be permitted to go into Tokyo.
Yes, Kami-
But if I inspect you, and you are NOT READY, you will be confined to your quarters for the night.
I see. Is anyone else ready to be inspected?
Then don't come back until you are! I will not permit filthy sailors to go on liberty in Tokyo.
Looks like they all left to double check their uniforms.
It would seem so.

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you have high standards.
You're being too hard on them.
Do whatever you think is right.

Fields.DialogueText: And I'm glad at least one person on board appreciates that, Kanchou.
A warship must be a hard place, Kanchou.
I always do.
When you're done here, come find me in my cabin.
Hai.
Enemy inbound! Full speed into battle!
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Come in.
Forgive my delay. I had to ensure the crew was ready to go ashore into Tokyo.
How many did you confine to their quarters for failing?
Not many. After the first two were confined, the rest learned quickly.

Fields.MenuText: Your methods are effective.
That was harsh.
I'm glad you took care of it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you approve, Kanchou.
But necessary. The others learned from their example and improved.
Doitamashite. You are welcome.
Now that you're done, I thought you could join me for a meal.
Really?
I know you can't leave the ship, so I had some street food brought up here that we could enjoy together.
I thought I smelled something familiar.
Some yakitori, some ramen, and a few doriyaki.
Doriyaki cakes? Dōmo arigatō, Kanchou.
This is quite thoughtful of you. I am grateful.
Sounds like I found something you like. Shall we eat?
Itadakimasu!
Bon appétit.
Hmph!
If I didn't know better, I'd think you were about to throw that lookout overboard.
That insufferable fool. She keeps looking at Tokyo with her binoculars instead of looking for Funayūrei on the horizon. If I catch her one more time...
I was wrong.
Maybe you are going to throw that lookout overboard.
If I did, she would probably try to swim back home to Tokyo.

Fields.MenuText: They're not focused enough on the mission.
It's only natural for them to worry about their homes and families.
She's not a strong swimmer. Wait a few more miles before throwing her overboard so she can't make it back to Tokyo.

Fields.DialogueText: Precisely, Kanchou. And it is our job to fix that.
The homeland is foremost in my mind, but focusing on the mission is what serves Japan best!
Haha!
We cannot tolerate distractions in a war zone.
I can't argue with that. Let's keep ourselves ready for anything.
I still need to deal with that lookout.
At your discretion, Kamikaze, but remember one thing.
Looking at Tokyo through binoculars isn't the same thing as desertion. No swimming this time, understood?
Understood. Swim calls are not authorized.
Let's keep everybody inside the lifelines while we can.
@BATTLE
Oh? What's that? Did you actually laugh?
I did, but... but only because you surprised me with your humor.
Make your report, lookout. What did you see?
It was dark... It was hard to see, ma'am...
Stop babbling! Have some confidence and tell me what you saw.
Ugh! Dismissed, lookout. Return to your post, for whatever good it will do.
Is everything all right?
I cannot get reliable answers. The lookouts are reporting ridiculous things.
What sort of ridiculous things?
Large, dark shapes on the horizon. Black silhouettes.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's a Morgana.
They're teasing you.
Maybe they're telling the truth.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't sense any Funayūrei.
Would they be so bold to tease me? I think not.
Impossible.
I just... can't imagine the possibility.
Just say it, Kamikaze.
The possibility that we are being stalked by an umibōzu.
An umi-
*ALARM*
We're not finished here. Talk to me again after this.
Hai. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Morganas spotted to the north.
I sense them, Kanchou. All main guns are ready for action.
Let's send them packing, Kamikaze.
Hai.
@BATTLE
The Funayūrei have been dispatched, Kanchou.
With spirited efficiency as usual, Kamikaze. Nice work.
Is there anything else you wish me to add to the after-action report, Kanchou?
Please explain.
Anything from the combat that seemed... unusual?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing.
Did anything seem strange to you?
Is this about that umibōzu thing you mentioned earlier?

Fields.DialogueText: Very well, Kanchou.
I am not sure.
If you have something to say, say it.
Please forget that I said anything, Kanchou. Perhaps I should just get some rest.
If you change your mind, you know where to find me.
Of course.
*SLAM*
I have tried to be patient with them.
I have tried to exercise restraint with them.
And I have tried reminding you to knock before coming in to my cabin...
Kuso!
Don't worry about it. Just give me a minute to put some clothes on.
I... I apologize, Kanchou.
There. All dressed. Now, explain to me why you're upset.
We have a problem with the crew. They are starting ridiculous rumors about seeing umibōzu and yōkai.
I'm going to need more words.
An umibōzu is a Japanese demon, a giant black silhouette. They demand a barrel, and then they use it to pour water on a ship until it sinks.

Fields.MenuText: And you're sure these are just rumors?
Sounds like a stupid prank to me.
What do you think is going on here?

Fields.DialogueText: Please don't tease me. Dealing with an immature crew is bad enough.
My thoughts exactly.
I think we have a problem more serious than umibōzu and the like.
We have troublemakers among us. They are spreading ghost stories to scare the crew.
Why would they do that?
I suspect they are cowards who have no fighting spirit. They just want to go home.
I know that face.
Excuse me?
Your face. We've been together long enough for me to know it. There's something else you aren't admitting to me.
*ALARM*
We will talk about this later, Kamikaze. Get our guns ready.
Hai, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
The door is unlocked, Kamikaze. Come in.
Thank you, Kanchou.
And thank you for knocking this time.
If you are recalling my previous error to make me blush, you'll have to try harder.
Oh? Is that a challenge?
A challenge...
Bad idea! You and challenges are a dangerous combination. Forget I mentioned it.
Kanchou, being ordered to forget something is...
All right! Please just tell me what you needed to report.
Hai, Kanchou. It is a simple request.
I intend to have the crew reorganize all of our ammunition storage. For that reason, we must keep the ship as steady as possible.
Fine. We'll avoid rough seas and extreme maneuvers until it's done.
Arigatō.

Fields.MenuText: That's a good punishment for the recent pranks.
Make sure they do a good job. I want us ship-shape!
Do we really need to organize all of the ammunition again?

Fields.DialogueText: I am not trying to punish them.
It pleases me to know that we desire the same things, Kanchou.
Hai. We must make sure the ship is organized and tidy.
Besides, the crew must focus on work instead of ghost stories and rumors.
Are you ready to talk? We never did finish that conversation from before.
I would prefer to commence my work immediately, Kanchou.
All right. Another time, then.
Something's still bothering her.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Kamikaze, you're littering sheets of paper everywhere. That's not how we keep a clean ship.
I have been taking notes.
Let me help you pick these up. What's this all about?
Ship's log entries. Observations. Official statements from the crew.
Official statements?
For my investigation.
That still didn't answer my question.
I discovered a serious problem this morning. Our ammunition has been stored incorrectly.
Hold on a second. I thought you just had the entire crew fix all of that.
We did fix it, but when I inspected the ammunition today, everything was a mess again.
Now I understand. You're launching an official investigation into the matter.
I thought that was obvious.

Fields.MenuText: This is a serious problem. Proceed with your investigation.
Maybe somebody is just trying to get under your skin. Don't let it rattle you.
What if something else is going on?

Fields.DialogueText: I will pursue the matter diligently, Kanchou.
Tampering with our ability to wage war effectively is the surest way to do that!
Now I am the one who does not understand.
You don't think your umibōzu had anything to do with this?
What?! How can you say that to me?!
I'm sorry, Kamikaze. I'm just trying to keep an open mind. After all, you Belles are pretty otherworldly yourselves.
Forgive my outburst, Kanchou.
You know, we really do need to have that talk. The one where you tell me what's going on with you.
Do you understand what I'm talking about?
Hai.
*ALARM*
Kuso! The Funayūrei witches know exactly when they are not wanted.
Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Enemy inbound! Full speed into battle!
@BATTLE
All critical repairs from the last Morgana combat are done. Why do I smell smoke?
Kamikaze? Where are you?
Out here on the fantail, Kanchou.
Strange time for a bonfire.
I am almost done.
Are you going to explain this, or do I have to ask?

Fields.MenuText: Roasting marshmallows?
A ceremonial fire to banish the evil spirits everybody keeps talking about?
You hate paperwork as much as I do, and this is your solution. I'll admit, it's clever.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm destroying something.
No, and please do not mock me like that.
You're joking with me, but in a way you are right.
My investigation of the improper ammo storage is finished. I am disposing of my notes.
By burning them? What did they say to upset you like this?
The reports were completely insulting. I have never been more disgusted with a crew!
Kamikaze, what do the reports say?
What they say doesn't matter. I can read between the lines. The crew resents my strict discipline, and they are mocking me with more pranks!
Finish burning your trash, and then get some rest.
Hai, Kanchou.
*sigh*
Another private meeting in your cabin?
I hope that's not a problem.
On the contrary. Don't think me unprofessional, but sharing privacy with you is...
Relaxing.

Fields.MenuText: The feeling is mutual.
You're not afraid of things getting too comfortable?
I'm not worried about fraternization. A Belle and her captain should be close.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. It means we respect each other.
I am more afraid of being unworthy of fighting for Japan.
I suppose we agree, then.
I need to tell you, Kanchou, that the crew's behavior troubles me.
You think they're making it personal?
Ridiculous rumors about ghosts and umibōzu to mock my respect for Japanese folklore...
Sabotaging our perfect ammunition storage to show contempt for my discipline...
That's a lot to worry about.
I must fix this immature crew. Weak ships cannot protect Japan against the Funayūrei.
You are forgetting something important.
What's that, Kanchou?
You're not supposed to worry about this all by yourself.
Arigatō. I greatly appreciate that.
*ALARM*
Looks like another problem has appeared.
Let's solve it, then.
@BATTLE
Urgent message from Command, Kanchou!
Catch your breath and tell me what it says.
We are being hunted.
Multiple ships have reported encounters with the Funayūrei named Madness.
Madness? I haven't heard of that one.
Of all the ships that radioed Command and reported encountering Madness, every single one failed to return home.
I see.

Fields.MenuText: Then it's a good thing that Japan's No. 1 destroyer is ready.
Madness sounds scary.
We have to stop her before any other ships are lost.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai!
I will not be intimidated. Neither should you.
Agreed.
I'm glad she's hunting us.
Really?
It's been too long since I've been challenged.
@BATTLE
I sense her presence, Kanchou. A powerful Funayūrei is lurking nearby.
Call her out.
Pathetic Funayūrei, we are unafraid of you. Why not show yourself and hasten your defeat?
Impudent little ship!
Kanchou!
You will die of fright when I reveal my form to you!

Fields.MenuText: I doubt that.
Show yourself!
I'll try not to laugh at how ugly you are.

Fields.DialogueText: But you will! To see Madness is to see your death...
I am coming for you...
You will learn humility at the bottom of the ocean...
I am hunting you. You will see me when I decide to let you.
Sounds like a foolish ghost story to me. I doubt you even exist.
Your taunts will not work on me.
Consider it a challenge.
It makes no difference. You will be sent to the ocean floor whenever I choose!
But first, I will let my sisters play with you a while...
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Kanchou!
This seems urgent, so I won't scold you about forgetting to knock on my cabin door again.
Look!
What did you just throw on my desk? A black robe and a creepy mask? Is this what I think it is?
Hai! The costume of our "umibōzu" that has been haunting the crew.
I'm impressed!
I found it in Seaman Nakamura's locker. He admitted they were his, so he has been placed in custody.

Fields.MenuText: A court-martial, then? We can't tolerate mischief like this during wartime.
The death penalty...
Is keel-hauling still allowed? I can't remember. If it is, let's do that.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. And the sentence must be death.
It's the proper sentence. I wasn't sure you would actually endorse that.
I hope you are joking.
It's a serious offense.
I don't like having my hand forced. Let Seaman Nakamura sit in the brig for a while.
Now we have proof for our crew that this umibōzu and ghost story stuff is nonsense.
They'll have nothing to be afraid of now.
Except for Madness.
Kanchou, I sense the presence of...
*ALARM*
Morganas. Guns up, Kamikaze!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I brought some tea.
Arigatō.
Your speech to the crew... It was... good.
Ha! I've never heard you pull a punch before, Kamikaze.
It was a good speech. However, they did not seem comforted by proof that the ghosts and monsters were fake.
It's because they know Madness is still out there, hunting us.
At least they are scared of something real.
True. Oh, and thanks for trying to help with a tsugumi drum performance afterward.
I admit, it failed to rally their spirits as much as I would have liked.

Fields.MenuText: Don't give up.
Maybe their morale is sunk for good.

Fields.DialogueText: I won't.
If anybody can raise it, I know you can do it, Kanchou.
There's only one way to inspire them. We have to show them what courage looks like.
That's all I've ever tried to do.
I know you have. Now, however, we're up against what might be our biggest challenge...
Challenge? Did you say challenge?
I thought that might get your attention.
Excuse me, Kanchou. I sense the presence of a powerful Funayūrei.
@BATTLE
The Funayūrei keep coming in waves.
They're starting to wear me out. Do you think Madness is behind this?
What do you think?
We have our answer.
My sisters have enjoyed playing with you.

Fields.MenuText: Why let them have all the fun? Show yourself.
Good. I was afraid we were playing too rough with them.
They don't seem to like it as much as you think.

Fields.DialogueText: I decide when that will be!
I will remove that smug confidence with my cold embrace.
Oh, but I have enjoyed it. I relish seeing your false hopes build.
Your time is short. I am coming soon.
I wish she would just appear. Listening to her without seeing her tries my patience!
The crew is probably scared. Don't let them see you get rattled.
Of course.
*ALARM*
More "sisters" are coming?
Hai.
@BATTLE
Something is wrong, Kanchou.
Talk to me.
I feel the presence of a Funayūrei, but I cannot see one.
What do you mean?
Madness is stalking us, but if I can feel her presence, she should be close enough to see.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe she radiates a bigger aura than other Morganas.
Maybe she can make herself invisible.
Maybe Madness isn't a Morgana.

Fields.DialogueText: So that we feel her even when she's too far away to see? It's possible.
I hope that isn't true.
I considered that, but her presence feels like other Funayūrei... just more powerful.
I just had a terrible thought. What if we can't see Madness because...
Because she's beneath us?
There's one way to find out. Start firing depth charges!
*BOOM*
That wasn't very nice of you.
Clever, but not nice.
I recognize that voice... that's not Madness, that's Venom!
Message to Command, immediately! Tell them that Venom has been masquerading as Madness and luring ships to their deaths!
Hai. And now let's get ready for her to come up!
@BATTLE
Somehow we did it. We managed to drive away Venom. How are you doing, Kamikaze?
The battle was hard, but I'll survive. Our damage control teams outdid themselves.
The crew looks exhausted, but tired is better than scared, I guess.
A welcome change. I don't know how much longer we would have lasted.
Maybe it's time to head back to Tokyo.
I can't say that I would object.
Oh, but I would! You will never see Tokyo again!

Fields.MenuText: I'm getting tired of that stupid voice!
Sounds like a challenge to me. What do you think?
We have a lot more fight left.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's silence it for good, Kanchou.
Challenge accepted! I never back down from a challenge.
I am with you, and so are my guns. Let's go!
You are mine. I will lay you on the ocean floor alongside my other victims.
@BATTLE
If I thought I was tired before, I was wrong. Now I'm tired.
Agreed. My hull has never taken such a battering.
Are you going to be all right?
Thank you for your concern, but I think my sides will hold together.
I'd appreciate that. Without you, the crew and I would have to swim back to Tokyo.
Ha! Please, Kanchou, don't make me laugh. It hurts too much!
What a tender moment! If I had a heart, how warm it would be right now.
No... No... No...
If you have a heart, how cold is it now? Can you feel me inside of it, laughing at you?
Are you ready to be the latest victim of my poison, my madness?
I'm getting sick of Morganas eavesdropping on us. Are you, Kamikaze?
Thoroughly, Kanchou.
I think Venom has one fight left before she's done.
What a coincidence, Kanchou.
So do I.
@BATTLE
The Funayūrei aura... it's gone! It's finally gone!
Are you sure?
After being haunted by Venom's aura for so long...
I can't tell you how good it feels to be free of it.
You did it! That's my Belle!
Hurry, Kanchou. Your tea is getting cold.
Sorry to keep you waiting. I had to make sure Command got our mission report.
Of course. It should help other ships avoid problems with Funayūrei like Venom.
It took a few beatings, but hopefully she'll lay off those sorts of tricks for a while.
Answer something for me.
Of course, Kanchou.
Did you ever believe, even for a moment, that we were being haunted by an umibōzu?
I admit that I wanted to believe it.
I care deeply for traditional Japanese folklore. A part of me wanted to actually see an umibōzu.
Odd, but I understand. I know those stories are special to you.
Exactly! When someone used that folklore as a hoax, it felt cheap. It insulted me.
Personally, I'm glad it was only a hoax. Morgana nightmare ships are enough for me.
Ha! Then I will have to teach you more appreciation for Japanese stories!
Also, teacher, explain to me why we're drinking tea! Wouldn't a few glasses of shochu be better?
Shochu? Really?
Tea is good for a Belle and her captain, but friends can drink shochu together, right?
That would be wrong for us.
Oh.
It would be wrong because I feel a bond that is more than friendship, Kanchou.
You earned my respect as my Kanchou, but there is more. You understand me. Challenge me. Improve me.
I've never let anybody else get this close to my heart.
I feel that way, too. Should we... talk about it?
Hai. Perhaps we should.
